Macros
Command Codes

Macros

#define UART_CMD_LOOPBACK   0U
 Command code used by UART_control() to place the UART in loopback mode. More...
 
#define UART_CMD_GET_STATS   1U
 Command code used by UART_control() to get the UART Instance statistics. More...
 

Detailed Description

UART_CMD_* macros are general command codes for UART_control(). Not all UART driver implementations support these command codes.

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ UART_CMD_GET_STATS

#define UART_CMD_GET_STATS   1U

Command code used by UART_control() to get the UART Instance statistics.

This command is available to get the statistics associated with the UART instance. This is a debug only feature. With this command code, arg is a pointer to the UART_Stats structure.

◆ UART_CMD_LOOPBACK

#define UART_CMD_LOOPBACK   0U

Command code used by UART_control() to place the UART in loopback mode.

This command is available to place the UART Driver in loopback mode. This is a debug only feature. With this command code, arg is a pointer to an integer. *arg contains the status of the loopback. 1 will enable the loopback and 0 will disable it
